title: [$$] Agree to Facebook’s Terms or Don’t Use It
text: Reblog A battle is looming in Europe over what information Facebook Inc., Alphabet Inc.’s Google and other companies can demand from you. It boils down to what they really need to know—a debate that could get stuck in courts for years with the potential to weaken either the European Union’s new data-privacy law or the business models of ad-reliant giants like Facebook and Google. The EU’s new privacy law, which goes into effect on May 25, forbids companies from forcing users to turn over personal information as a condition of using their services.
